  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-35179].
  {panel}

Currently, the new user dropdown list only shows suggestions to improve its performance. In JIRA versions prior to 5.0, the dropdown list shows all possible assignees and does not support suggestions. 
In the latest JIRA version, you can still show the pre-JIRA 5 dropdown list as per this kb article: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/How+to+fully+render+assignee+drop-down+list+in+JIRA

However, in JIRA 5.1.1 the dropdown list is able to show *both the suggestion box and the list of all assignable users*. As per this screenshot: [^UserPicker511.jpg]

We should allow reverting back to this version of the dropdown list as well.

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-35165].
  {panel}

Hey guys,

We are moving JIRA from OnDemand to Standalone instance ... and it looks like there is no link to "JIRA User Server" under "Administration
/User management" any longer ... meaning I cannot create an app to access JIRA users from outside (i.e. from Confluence).

I am logged as sysadmin and this account belongs to 'system-administrators' group.

Here are options available:
!options.png!

*WORKAROUND:*
Navigating directly to http://<local-installation>/secure/admin/ConfigureCrowdServer.jspa will reveal the screen for setting up externally-acessible user management.

To re-enable this, please back up your data, run the following query, and restart JIRA:

{code:sql}UPDATE pluginstate SET pluginenabled='true' WHERE pluginkey='jira.webfragments.admin:crowdApplication';{code}
fields.summary: No link to JIRA User Server in JIRA 6.1 after migrating from OnDemand

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-35164].
  {panel}

10/03/2013 at 01:10 Added comment to the issue MYPROJECT-22
10/03/2013 at 02:12 Added comment to the issue MYPROJECT-22

Then I use {code}/rest/api/2/search
Jql =(project = MYPROJECT AND updated >= "2013-10-03 02:11")
fields = labels,created,updated,status{code}

And I do not get any issues

Then I try another query 
{code}/rest/api/2/search
Jql =(project = MYPROJECT AND updated >= "2013-10-03 01:09")
fields = labels,created,updated,status{code}

And I see that the date "updated" was not changed
{code}
...
[key:protected] => MYPROJECT-22
[fields:protected] => Array
    (
        ...
        [Updated] => 2013-10-03T01:10:10.000-0700
        [Created] => 2013-10-02T05:18:18.000-0700
        ... 
    )
...
{code}
But if you try to get information about this issue directly
{code}/rest/api/2/issue/MYPROJECT-22{code}
You can see that updated date was changed
{code}
Array
( 
[key] => MYPROJECT-22
[fields] => Array
    (
    ...
    [created] => 2013-10-02T05:18:18.643-0700
    [updated] => 2013-10-03T02:12:28.963-0700
    ...
    )
)
{code}
Seems that "updated" date of an issue chages when was added or edited comment of this issue, but doesn't change when comment was deleted from it.

Is this a bug?
If not, how can I get over /rest/api/2/search all the issues were comments were delted since a certain date?

Hello

I wanted to inquire of the possibility of having a commerical license tier of 501-1,000 users. 

Currently we have an unlimited license which is due to expire in February 2014. As a small company we have more than 500 but less than 1,000 employees. Currently if we had to renew it would be a $4,000 increase from our last renewal which I've already been told is unacceptable.

Other than IT projects we use Jira as a Help Desk ticketing system. Although a good majority of our 700 employees never log onto Jira, we use it to communicate automaticaly upon opening/closing a ticket or email them with further follow up. 

It appears my only option is to remove these non-essential customers from the Jira Users Group which will result in our license limit to decrease, but will impact how we communicate to our in-house customers. 

Unless you have any other suggestions

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-35125].
  {panel}

*Background*
Global JIRA administrators delegate parts of the daily work to the project leads/project administrators such as managing project roles. Especially in larger enterprise instances with hundreds of projects managing project roles seems to be a common task for project administrators.

*Current behaviour*
Now if an user tries to open an issue he/she does not have the permission to view he/she gets an permission violation screen. On this permission violation screen the only contacts currently named are the "JIRA administrators". 

*Improvement* 
But if project role administration is mostly done by project administrators, it would be helpful to show the name/s of the project lead/project administrators for the current project on the permission violation screen as well. Users could than directly contact the project lead and in most cases would get faster access to the project/issue than by contacting global JIRA administrators.
As not every installation of JIRA would like to have this feature, e.g. public mode instances, showing the project leads/project administrators on the permission violation screen should be optional. This could be a global option or a per-project option. An additional option could be to show just the plain name or an e-mail link.
fields.summary: Option for showing project lead/project administrators on permission violation screen

Precondition: Clear cookies and cashe in your browser.
STR:
1. Browse Jira as logged in user (use your own account)
2. Proceed to Tempo
3. Click on right and / or left arrows (to list days to see reported hours for activities)
ACT:
Pop up with "The JIRA server could not be contacted. This may be a temporary glitch or the server may be down." error message appears for a second and disappears. 
Please see attached screenshot: problem.png
EXP:
Jira pages are opened without any notification messages about server down-time or glitches.
NOTE:
This issue is reproducible if you open Jira page with daily reported hours for the first time only. Issue is not reproducible if you open page for the second time. 
Pop up with error message disappears in a second and Jira works as usually.

I make Tempo issue: https://tempoplugin.jira.com/browse/JTMPO-976

Please contact Atlassian about this as it is not within our scope. It could be useful for them to get some information about the system you are using.
Susanne Götz
Tempo team

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-35086].
  {panel}

According to the [Global Permission|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Managing+Global+Permissions] article:
{quote}
Permission to log in to JIRA.
(warning)  The number of users that count towards your JIRA license is the sum of all users (including users in groups) that 
{quote}

Upon the description, we understand that JIRA license is calculate based on the JIRA User permission. However, this is my finding below in JIRA 6.x vanilla instance:
* The user under *JIRA Users* and has *Active* condition will be count towards JIRA license.
* The user under *JIRA Administrators* and has *Active* condition will be count towards JIRA license (without *JIRA Users*).
* The user under *JIRA System Administrators* and has *Active* condition will be count towards JIRA license (without *JIRA Users* or *JIRA Administrators*).
* The users under *JIRA Users*, *JIRA Administrators* and has *Active* condition will be count towards JIRA license.
* The users under *JIRA Users*, *JIRA Administrators*, *JIRA System Administrators* and has *Active* condition will be count towards JIRA license.

In *summary*, if the user have any groups in Global Permission with *Active* condition, the user definitely count toward JIRA license and also able logged in JIRA. For example, comparing this two article:
* [JIRA Global Permission|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Managing+Global+Permissions]
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/How+to+Get+a+List+of+Active+Users+Counting+Towards+the+JIRA+License

The article could mislead our users in future about how user counts toward JIRA license.
fields.summary: Misleading documentation of managing user license

The following plugins are required by JIRA, but have not been started:

    Atlassian JIRA - Plugins - Project Config Plugin (com.atlassian.jira.jira-project-config-plugin)
    Embedded Gadgets Plugin (com.atlassian.gadgets.embedded)
    Gadget Dashboard Plugin (com.atlassian.gadgets.dashboard)
    Opensocial Plugin (com.atlassian.gadgets.opensocial)
    Gadget Directory Plugin (com.atlassian.gadgets.directory)
    Atlassian JIRA - Plugins - Gadgets Plugin (com.atlassian.jira.gadgets)


I followed the instructions found here: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/JIRA+does+not+Start+Due+to+Disabled+Bundled+Plugin but no dice.

fields.description:
Customfield: Teams, Multiselect, associated to certain issue types, global context
Basic jql-query: --> more --> "Teams" is available in all criteria and has a red exclamation mark on the side, that states the Summery's text "... is not available ..."
Advanced search: query "Teams =" usually I get a list of available values, but I get nothing; when I provide a valid value for the custom field than the query is executed correct.
Probably this is connected to plugins, that I have been experimenting before this issue was reported first:
JIRA Toolkit Plugin - still active
JIRA Workflow Toolbox - deactivated

This issue is extremely uncomfortable for our users. What else can I provide to help solving the issue?

Thanks a lot!
Kr Wolfgang

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-35060].
  {panel}

In versions of JIRA up to 6.0.7, the workflow transition screen has had an 'All' tab, which showed conditions, validators and post-functions:
!workflow_alltab.png!
In JIRA 6.1 it has disappeared:
!workflow_noalltab_61.png!

Please can we have it back. The 'All' tab is useful for getting a quick picture of everything a transition does. It lends itself well to screenshots for documenting workflows too.
fields.summary: Bring back the 'All' tab in workflow transitions

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-35036].
  {panel}

I18n message translation is broken for one of two gadgets in jira-timesheet-plugin in JIRA 6.1, reproduces with any 2.5.x plugin version and Mac OS or Ubuntu so far.

Both gadgets use the same i18n technique and both work fine and messages are resolved up to JIRA 6.0.8, however in JIRA 6.1 Pivot Gadget title and description messages are not resolved.

See https://bitbucket.org/azhdanov/jiratimesheet/issue-attachment/419/azhdanov/jiratimesheet/1380096342.82/419/MSG_gadget.png

Steps to reproduce

1) Install jira-timesheet-plugin-2.5.6.jar (https://marketplace.atlassian.com/download/plugins/jira-timesheet-plugin/version/360)
2) Go to Administration - System - System Dashboard, click Add Gadget, type 'timesheet' (without quotes) in quick filter box:

Expect: Title and Description are resolved for both Timesheet and Project Pivot gadgets.

See also https://bitbucket.org/azhdanov/jiratimesheet/issue/419/jira-61-__msg_gadgetprojectpivottitle__

  {panel}

Hi,

I would like the following feature to be implemented in JIRA: tree-level issue menu

We have a lot of issue types that have similar prefix like 'Support: consulting', 'Support: technical issue'. Other issue types have different prefixes. When I select 'Issue Type' in 'Create Issue' window I have plain list. It could be great if I suffix acts as parent of tree and the rest of issue type name acts as leaf. So I may choose from the following tree:

Support
     \-- Consulting
     \-- Techincal Issue
Development
     \-- User Interface

and so on.

Best regards,
Alexander Afonyashin

fields.description:
We are running Jira version: v5.2.11 (#854-sha1:ef00d61)

Stand on an issue. Select 'More Actions'/'Log Work'.

In the 'Log Work' window: Select another date than the present (i.e. wish to log some hours that were executed yesterday), Fill out the rest of the form and then click 'Log'. 

Red error text appears underneath the 'Date Started' field: "You must specify a date on which the work occurred."

If you select todays date (do not touch the 'Date Started' field) then there is no problem and the work is logged. 

Workaround: Log hours on todays date and write in the text when it was done.

Is this fixed in a later version of Jira (has tried to search the JRA project for similar experiences) or can it be fixed?
fields.summary: Error when creating work log back in time.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-35027].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

When changing the date time format in Look and Feel, the Issue View shows incorrect view.

h3. Steps to reproduce

# Navigate to Look and Feel
# Change the *Complete Date/Time Format* appending ZZZ at the end
# Change the *Day/Month/Year Format* appending ZZZ at the end

h3. Expected Result

As the preview column at the Look and Feel show, it should be rendered as {{23/May/07 6:55 AM Asia/Beirut}} on the date field across the instance

h3. Actual Result

When viewing an issue at issue view {{<base URL>/browse/<issue key>}}

Noticed that the Date field for *Created* and *Updated* shows as {{28/Nov/14 12:00 AM +0200+0200+0200}} instead.

!Screen Shot 2015-05-15 at 12.08.34 AM.png|thumbnail!

h3. Notes

* The bug does not affect the list view of Issue Navigator but the detail view
* The bug does not affect JIRA Agile's Issue Detail View

Originally Raised by Customer
{quote}please find the attached screen, it shows a wrong date time format as +0550+0550+0550 at the end,we have recently upgraded Jira from version 5.1.8 to Jira version 6.06.
{quote}

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-35019].
  {panel}

(This affects JIRA "6.1-OD-9-WN" but that version isn't an available option.)

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Create two projects, ONE and TWO.
# Create an issue in each of those two projects, and add attachments to both.
# Change the project key of ONE to THREE, and notice the attachment on THREE-1 (previously ONE-1) works fine.
# Move TWO-1 to the newly-renamed project THREE, TWO-1 now becomes THREE-2.
# The attachment is no longer accessible from THREE-2, and JIRA spits out the following error in the logs:
{code:none}
/browse/THREE-2 [jira.issue.thumbnail.DefaultThumbnailManager] Error writing to thumbnail file: /data/jirastudio/jira/home/data/attachments/ONE/ONE-2/thumbs/_thumb_10901.png
java.io.FileNotFoundException: /data/jirastudio/jira/home/data/attachments/ONE/ONE-2/10901 (No such file or directory)
{code}
fields.summary: Changing a project key then moving an issue with attachments into that newly-changed project causes the attachments on the issue to become unavailable

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-35018].
  {panel}

If a user is deleted from LDAP, if using a connector user directory on the next sync it will delete that user from JIRA. It doesn't appear this follows some of the inbuilt restrictions around deleting users in the GUI - for example you can delete a user from LDAP and it will remove them even if they're assigned issues. This can leave all sorts of orphaned information and cause problems.

Given we now have deactivate user functionality in JIRA, rather than deleting the user in JIRA can we deactivate the user? This would prevent us from getting into situations where deleting a user has caused problems in JIRA.

h3. Workaround

Deactivate the user in the LDAP engine and JIRA rather then deleting them.
fields.summary: Ability to detect a deleted user in LDAP and disable that user
"What's New" dialog should never show administrative changes
Allow comment to be marked as solution
